Package com.mhealthatlas.apps.controller

Class AppCommandController

java.lang.Object
com.mhealthatlas.apps.controller.AppCommandController
@Controller
@RequestMapping("/apps")
public class AppCommandController
extends java.lang.Object
AppCommandController is the class containing all API endpoints for mutating applications in the mHealthAtlas system.

  • Method Details

    • postAndroidApp

      @PostMapping("/android") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\')") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> postAndroidApp​(@RequestBody NewAndroidAppInfoDto newAndroidApp)
      Create or update an android application / android application version in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /apps/android

      Only Content Manager can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      newAndroidApp - the android application and android application version data; not null; required request body parameter
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response containing the android application id, if the android application / android application version was successfully added or changed;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if a required attribute is null in the NewAndroidAppInfoDto object or nothing is inserted or updated;

    • postIosApp

      @PostMapping("/ios") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\')") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> postIosApp​(@RequestBody NewIosAppInfoDto newIosApp)
      Create or update an ios application / ios application version in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /apps/ios

      Only Content Manager can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      newIosApp - the ios application and ios application version data; not null; required request body parameter
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response containing the ios application id, if the ios application / ios application version was successfully added or changed;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if a required attribute is null in the NewIosAppInfoDto object or nothing is inserted or updated;

    • postPrivateCustomerApp

      @PostMapping("/private") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\', \'ROLE_Company_Admin\')") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> postPrivateCustomerApp​(@RequestBody NewPrivateCustomerAppInfoDto newPrivateCustomerApp)
      Create or update an private customer application / private customer application version in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /apps/private

      Only a Content Manager or a Company Admin can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      newPrivateCustomerApp - the private customer application and private customer application version data; not null; required request body parameter
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response containing the private customer application id, if the private customer application / private customer application version was successfully added or changed;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if a required attribute is null in the NewPrivateCustomerAppInfoDto object or nothing is inserted or updated;

    • deleteAndroidApp

      @DeleteMapping("/android/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteAndroidApp​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      Delete an android application with all the related android application version in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /apps/android/{id}

      Only Content Manager can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the android application id; not null; required request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the android application was successfully deleted;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the specified android application id does not exists;

    • deleteIosApp

      @DeleteMapping("/ios/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteIosApp​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      Delete an ios application with all the related ios application version in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /apps/ios/{id}

      Only Content Manager can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the ios application id; not null; required request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the ios application was successfully deleted;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the specified ios application id does not exists;

    • deletePrivateCustomerApp

      @DeleteMapping("/private/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\', \'ROLE_Company_Admin\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deletePrivateCustomerApp​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      Delete an private customer application with all the related private customer application version in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /apps/private/{id}

      Only a Content Manager or a Company Admin can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the private customer application id; not null; required request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the private customer application was successfully deleted;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the specified private customer application id does not exists;

    • updateAndroidAppRelationship

      @PostMapping("/android/{id}/references/{targetAppType}/{targetId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\')") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> updateAndroidAppRelationship​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id, @PathVariable AppType targetAppType, @PathVariable java.lang.Long targetId)
      Relate an android application with an ios application in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /apps/android/{id}/references/{targetAppType}/{targetId}

      This method should be called when the same application exists in the Google Playstore and the Apple Appstore to related this application in the mHealthAtlas system.
      Currently only Ios can be chosen as the target application platform.

      Only Content Manager can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the android application id; not null; required request path parameter
      targetAppType - the target app type; not null; required request path parameter
      targetId - the target app id; not null; required request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the android application and the target application was successfully related;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the specified android application or target application does not exists or the target platform is not Ios;

    • updateIosAppRelationship

      @PostMapping("/ios/{id}/references/{targetAppType}/{targetId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\')") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> updateIosAppRelationship​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id, @PathVariable AppType targetAppType, @PathVariable java.lang.Long targetId)
      Relate an ios application with an ios application in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /apps/ios/{id}/references/{targetAppType}/{targetId}

      This method should be called when the same application exists in the Google Playstore and the Apple Appstore to related this application in the mHealthAtlas system.
      Currently only Android can be chosen as the target application platform.

      Only Content Manager can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the ios application id; not null; required request path parameter
      targetAppType - the target app type; not null; required request path parameter
      targetId - the target app id; not null; required request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the ios application and the target application was successfully related;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the specified ios application or target application does not exists or the target platform is not Android;

    • removeAndroidAppRelationship

      @PostMapping("/android/{id}/separate") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> removeAndroidAppRelationship​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      Separates android application from a related ios application in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /apps/android/{id}/separate

      This method should be called when the an android application was wrongly related with an ios application.

      Only Content Manager can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the android application id; not null; required request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the android application is separated;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the specified android application does not exists;

    • removeIosAppRelationship

      @PostMapping("/ios/{id}/separate") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Content_Manager\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> removeIosAppRelationship​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      Separates ios application from a related ios application in the application service database.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /apps/ios/{id}/separate

      This method should be called when the an ios application was wrongly related with an ios application.

      Only Content Manager can call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the ios application id; not null; required request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the ios application is separated;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the specified ios application does not exists;
